intro: Cyrtandra santosii, commonly known as Santos' cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hair. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests or on rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
